feedback:
Excellent application of the DRIVER framework throughout your work. You clearly demonstrated 6 stages: D, R, I, V, E, R2.


STRENGTHS:
- Financial APP: The submission shows a working financial tool with concrete transactional behavior (roundups transferred to savings), account integration, controls (limits/multiplier/pause), and reporting (total saved, weekly stats, analysis). IMPLEMENT evidence of functionality plus DISCOVER/REFLECT justification supports a thorough demonstration that this is a functioning financial application.


AREAS FOR IMPROVEMENT:
- Integrate AI: The submission clearly integrates AI functionality (an AI app builder and an AI analysis feature that provides personalized spending recommendations), so it is not a fail. However, the treatment is surface-level—there is evidence of useful AI output but little technical or detailed explanation of how the AI adds value or is implemented—so it meets PARTIAL.

criteria.criterion_name: Financial APP: The tool functions as a financial application.
evidence: "I made an app that rounds up any purchase and puts whatever was rounded up into a savings account."

"In the settings, you can choose which account you want it to be connected to. Then you can do a multiplier. ... you can also put a weekly limit on the roundup amount. ... And you can also pause it and get notifications as well."
"Over here, you got we're going to start with total saved. So, it'll tell you how much has been saved by taking that extra money that's been rounded up and putting it into a savings account."
criteria.driver_alignment:
- IMPLEMENT: Built and demonstrated core functionality (roundups, account linking, limits, multiplier, notifications).
- DISCOVER: Identified target user need ("a lot of college students have trouble saving up for certain goals").
- REFLECT: Articulated user benefit and purpose ("this is kind of a way to do it without actively thinking").
criteria.reasoning: The submission shows a working financial tool with concrete transactional behavior (roundups transferred to savings), account integration, controls (limits/multiplier/pause), and reporting (total saved, weekly stats, analysis). IMPLEMENT evidence of functionality plus DISCOVER/REFLECT justification supports a thorough demonstration that this is a functioning financial application.

criteria.criterion_name: Integrate AI: The tool integrates AI capabilities effectively.
evidence: "I did this by using an AI app builder called base 44 and also I used some API keys as well."
"a lot of college students have trouble saving up for certain goals."

"there's also an AI and analysis that'll kind of analyze your financial purchases. So, it'll tell you your food spending. You spent a significant amount of food, particularly at Whole Foods and Starbucks. So, it tells you consider reducing these visits."
criteria.driver_alignment:
Discover: identified user need ("a lot of college students have trouble saving up for certain goals").  
Implement: built the app and used AI tooling/API keys ("AI app builder... API keys").  
Reflect: described the AI analysis output and user benefit (personalized spending insights and tips).
criteria.reasoning: The submission clearly integrates AI functionality (an AI app builder and an AI analysis feature that provides personalized spending recommendations), so it is not a fail. However, the treatment is surface-level—there is evidence of useful AI output but little technical or detailed explanation of how the AI adds value or is implemented—so it meets PARTIAL.
